data.title: Jota (Retired)
data.meta_description: Sad to see him without a club but I think this is a recurring problem for a lot of our players that moved on in the Dean Smith/Warburton era. When clubs...
data.text:
Shirley Bee

Active member

Joined

27 Apr 2004

Messages

1,282

Reaction score

61

Location

Exiled to Brummieland

23 Nov 2021

#1,651

Sad to see him without a club but I think this is a recurring problem for a lot of our players that moved on in the Dean Smith/Warburton era. When clubs were paying big fees for our player back in 2014-2017, as they still are, I feel like we were the only club able to get the best out of them and knew how to play them. For example, Jota was brilliant for us but has never set the world alight since leaving us, Odubajo was great and is now doing OK at QPR, Gray did well for Burnley and Watford for a bit but is now at our retirement home QPR. Hogan, Dean and Colin have never really progressed, Hogan is scoring but nothing special, Dean doesn't start for them and Colin has proven to be a decent right back. Sawyers hasn't worked out at West Brom, Ryan Woods' career has not really gone far either. Mepham has been decent for Bournemouth but not progressed very far. Players from the Smith/Warburton era seem to only have been good for us, which makes me think we were the only ones who knew how to properly utilise them

Watched Derby v Bournemouth on Sky last Sunday. Mepham played 90 minutes and looked very composed. He's playing at the top of the Championship and for Wales. Not sure how far you expected him to progress. If/when Bournemouth get promoted it will be interesting to see how he copes in the Premier League and whether he has "progressed" as far as his old partner Konsa at Villa.

If/when Bournemouth get promoted it will be interesting to see how he copes in the Premier League and whether he has "progressed" as far as his old partner Konsa at Villa.

I think Mepham is a great player but he hasn't progressed like others for his fee. According to various sites he went for 12m+, correct me if I am wrong, now Konsa went for a similar amount and has processed massively and is now being tipped to play for England. He is still a very good player but he hasn't exactly set the world alight at Bournemouth

Loved him. Remember Watford away, night game, not long after he joined us. The way he swerved through their players bought the away end to its feet. Knew then he was extra special and so he proved to be. Bought passion as well as skills and will always be a massive favourite. For me, just ahead of Romaine, but behind Said.

Mansley was my favourite player of that time by a merry mile. Signed from Skelmersdale? Despite BFC not having a pot to piss in then, happy days.

Sad to see him without a club but I think this is a recurring problem for a lot of our players that moved on in the Dean Smith/Warburton era. When clubs were paying big fees for our player back in 2014-2017, as they still are, I feel like we were the only club able to get the best out of them and knew how to play them. For example, Jota was brilliant for us but has never set the world alight since leaving us, Odubajo was great and is now doing OK at QPR, Gray did well for Burnley and Watford for a bit but is now at our retirement home QPR. Hogan, Dean and Colin have never really progressed, Hogan is scoring but nothing special, Dean doesn't start for them and Colin has proven to be a decent right back. Sawyers hasn't worked out at West Brom, Ryan Woods' career has not really gone far either. Mepham has been decent for Bournemouth but not progressed very far. Players from the Smith/Warburton era seem to only have been good for us, which makes me think we were the only ones who knew how to properly utilise them

Conversly

Andre Gray, James Tarkowski, John Egan, Jack O'Connell, Adam Forshaw, Stuart Dallas and Romaine Sawyers off the top of my head all won promotion to the Premiership before we did. So its seem a bit rose tinted.

One thing I'll remember about Jota. It was either his GP debut or the first time I'd seen him play, early days whatever it was. A long cross field ball was played to him and he controlled it but also took it over the defender marking him in one move. He didn't get a goal from the resulting chance but my God it would have been the best goal I've ever seen live if he did.

Does this ring bells for anyone? I've not got a clue who we were playing!

Two excellent signings without the scouting system that brought Jota to GP. Folan is a good shout here for the BFC Mercurial XI.

Two excellent signings without the scouting system that brought Jota to GP. Folan is a good shout here for the BFC Mercurial XI.

I‚Äôve got a feeling they both signed at the same time, but it could be my memory playing tricks. According to one of my school mates, Alan Mansley had a second job, working part time in a sweet shop. Maybe that‚Äôs why he needed to lose a bit!

Getting back to Jota, he was a fantastic watch. I suppose you can‚Äôt blame him for moving for more money, but the old showbiz saying of ‚Äòleave ‚Äòem knowing they want more‚Äô is pretty accurate in his case.

#1,698

Feel a bit for Jota, never really worked at Villa. Had some good times at Birmingham though. Not sure how they‚Äôll reflect on his time given his talent

Did he?

He had a shocking time after Steve Cotterill replaced Redknapp and seemed to be universally hated. That was when people suggested he could come back on loan to us as he'd already played for two clubs and that is the most allowed in the season.

I think he blossomed relatively once Monk took over. One take I heard from one of their fans was was "he's great, but inconsistent" - some echoes in that from his time with us though I am sure he hit higher heights and has more good memories of his time with us. Maybe he did have some memorable times there too. Three goals and 11 assists in the second season.

I think he was sold a dream by big spending Harry that they were signing loads of great players and heading to the PL ASAP I'm sure he wasn't the only one a bit let down by the reality. Those two seasons of chopping and changing they came 19th and 17th (the latter with a points deduction).

Nearly five years since he left us, strange to think.

Wise old Bee
